name: Glass Terrarium
budget_mid: Zoo Med ReptiBreeze or Exo Terra with front opening
budget_premium: Custom glass enclosure with sliding doors
notes: Glass enclosures retain heat and humidity well. Ensure mesh top for ventilation.

name: PVC Enclosure
budget_premium: Custom PVC with sliding acrylic doors
notes: PVC is lightweight, easy to clean, and excellent for humidity control. Ideal for larger setups.

name: Screen Enclosure
notes: Screen enclosures provide excellent ventilation but require more effort to maintain humidity. Best for species that need high airflow.

name: UVB Linear Fixture
infoLink2_label: Zoo Med ReptiSun 5.0 Mini Compact Fluorescent Lamp 13 Watts

name: Heat Lamp & Bulb
budget_mid: Zoo Med Mini Deep Dome + halogen
notes: Use thermostat to prevent overheating. NO heat mats (burn risk). Ceramic Heat Emitter (CHE) or Deep Heat Projector (DHP) recommended with thermostat.

name: Substrate
notes: Avoid moss (bacteria/impaction risk). Use thick leaf litter layer to protect sensitive skin.

name: Soil-Based Substrate
budget_premium: Premium organic soil blend with minerals
notes: Good for plants and naturalistic setups. Ensure soil is fertilizer-free and pesticide-free.

name: Paper-Based Substrate
notes: Easy to replace and clean. Good for minimal setups. May need more frequent changes.

name: Foam Substrate
notes: Lightweight, reusable, and easy to clean. Great for enclosures where weight is a concern. Non-biodegradable.

name: Drainage Layer (LECA or clay balls)
notes: Essential for bioactive setups. Prevents water logging.

name: Drainage Barrier (mesh screen)
notes: Prevents substrate from mixing with drainage layer.

name: Springtail Culture
sizing: Standard for enclosures up to 36" Ã— 18"

name: Isopod Culture (Dwarf White or similar)
sizing: Tropical species suitable for higher humidity setups

name: Climbing Branches & Perches
notes: Cork bark, manzanita, or bamboo recommended. Whites Tree Frogs prefer horizontal perches.

name: Plants (live or artificial)
notes: Beginners: artificial plants are easier. Advanced: Pothos, ferns, bromeliads are good starter species.

name: Live Plants
notes: Excellent for bioactive setups and naturalistic aesthetics. Pothos, ferns, and bromeliads are reliable starter species.

name: Artificial Plants
notes: Easy to maintain, won't wilt, and great for minimalist or display-focused setups. Ensure materials are non-toxic.

name: Automated Misting System
notes: Ideal for high-humidity species. Allows consistent humidity levels without daily manual misting. Recommended timer: 1-3 minutes, 1-3 times daily.

name: Ultrasonic or Cool Mist Humidifier
notes: Effective for maintaining consistent ambient humidity. Ensure it's food-safe (no essential oils). Clean regularly to prevent mold.

name: Fogger (Ultrasonic Humidification)
notes: Creates fine mist for high humidity needs. Great for bioactive setups with plants. Use filtered water to prevent mineral buildup.

name: Digital Thermometer & Hygrometer
sizing: Monitor both warm and cool zones. Critical for temperature regulation.
